perturbation.original_text: 1.4 Contract Term The commencement date for this contract will be 16th June 2004. The initial term of the contracted agreement is 5 years from the commencement date. The BSP then have the option to renew the agreement for another 5 years subject to any restructuring of the agreement as required by the parties. Either party may advise the other of the impending expiry of the then current term, generally in accordance with section 14 .
perturbation.changed_text: 1.4 Contract Term The commencement date for this contract will be 16th June 2004. The initial term of the contracted agreement is 5 years from the commencement date. The BSP then have the option to renew the agreement for another 3 years subject to any restructuring of the agreement as required by the parties. Either party may advise the other of the impending expiry of the then current term, generally in accordance with section 14 .
perturbation.explanation: The initial term is set at 5 years. However, the renewal period is changed to 3 years. This creates uncertainty about the total duration of the contract and the rights of renewal.

perturbation.original_text: 14.3 Termination By BSP For Convenience The BSP may terminate the whole or any part of this agreement for convenience at any time by giving Datec at least 6 months prior written notice. 14.4 Termination By Datec For Convenience Datec may terminate the whole or any part of this agreement for convenience at any time by giving the BSP at least 6 months prior written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.3 Termination By BSP For Convenience The BSP may terminate the whole or any part of this agreement for convenience at any time by giving Datec at least 6 months prior written notice. 14.4 Termination By Datec For Convenience Datec may terminate the whole or any part of this agreement for convenience at any time by giving the BSP at least 3 months prior written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The clause for termination by BSP requires 6 months' notice. The clause for termination by Datec is modified to require only 3 months' notice. This creates unequal termination rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 8.5 Rebates 1. Should Datec not achieve the agreed Service Levels contained in the Service Level Agreement as detailed in Schedule B, a monthly rebate will be applied as per the Rebate Table in Pricing Schedule C, 2. Rebates will apply to Severity Levels One (1) and Two (2) during the agreed business hours detailed in Schedule B. 3. The maximum rebate in any given month will be 50% of the monthly base fee. The rebate calculation will be completed before the 15th Day of the following month for the preceding month together with supporting monthly reports and provided to the BSP. 4. For the purposes of determining SLA achievement the "Time to Respond" measurement will be used. The following definition will apply: "Time to Respond" means, the time between the problem being logged and the customer being given a job number and the technician beginning the job" As this applies to Severity Levels One (1) and Two (2) this will also include the informing of Datec's senior operational management.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.5 Rebates 1. Should Datec not achieve the agreed Service Levels contained in the Service Level Agreement as detailed in Schedule B, a monthly rebate will be applied as per the Rebate Table in Pricing Schedule C, 2. Rebates will apply to Severity Levels One (1) and Two (2) during the agreed business hours detailed in Schedule B. 3. The maximum rebate in any given month will be 50% of the monthly base fee. The rebate calculation will be completed before the 15th Day of the following month for the preceding month together with supporting monthly reports and provided to the BSP. 4. For the purposes of determining SLA achievement the "Time to Resolve" measurement will be used. The following definition will apply: "Time to Resolve" means, the time between the problem being logged and the problem being fixed" As this applies to Severity Levels One (1) and Two (2) this will also include the informing of Datec's senior operational management.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of calculating rebate is changed from `Time to Respond` to `Time to Resolve`. This can cause uncertainty and change in how the rebate is calculated and also leads to disputes on which definition should be used.
